etymology.description: semantic: 肉(肉) (ròu, "flesh") + phonetic: 府(府) (fǔ) = decomposition of flesh -> ferment; spoil; decay
etymology.interpretation: 腐(fǔ) effectively combines the concept of rotting flesh, represented by 肉(肉) (ròu, "flesh"), with the phonetic 府(府) (fǔ), to convey the idea of decay or decomposition.

examples.chinese: 食物腐烂会产生异味(食物腐爛會產生異味)。
examples.english: Spoiled food produces a foul smell.

examples.chinese: 这瓶牛奶放久了(這瓶牛奶放久了)，就会腐坏(就會腐壞)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè píng niúnǎi fàng jiǔ le, jiù huì fǔhuài.
examples.english: This bottle of milk will spoil if left for too long.

examples.chinese: 鱼在高温下容易腐坏(魚在高溫下容易腐壞)。
examples.pinyin: Yú zài gāowēn xià róngyì fǔhuài.
examples.english: Fish tends to decay easily under high temperatures.
